answers.answer: No need to open a new thread with every question you have. You can add it onto your original post and it will be answered. There are limited questions allowed each day.
hi! i would say take a hpt if you have not taking one yet. good luck!!!
JB I told you in your first post that there is only about a 1 in 150 chance of pregnancy after having your tubes tied.Relax, take a HPT.  See your doctor if you don't feel better.

actually, med-help cleared that issue up for us about limited posts. there arent a limited number for this topic area...just to let you know. i know there were a LOT of heated discussions on that issue.
ok... my bad :( I totally misread that post and I'm sorry.... I should've read it again before posting again I apologize!!

actually, that quote is a little off. The only ones that are limited to 2 every 6 months are the ones with actual doctors answerimg questions. Those are the ones listed in the last post. However this forum IS restricted to a certain amount of new questions each day. There have been a couple times I've tried to post a new question and have gotten the Forum Full message. I would however like to see each person only take up one thread for all of their problems each day. I've actually found the archives on this site very helpful and have personally avoided taking up a thread on more than one occasion after finding my question answered.

actually harley-girl was right. There are a limited amount of questions per day BUT no one is limited to how many questions they can ask. The limits are for forums where there are only 2-3 new questions allowed per day.to quote medhelp:The "Do not post more than 2 new questions within a 6-month period, in forums (Public Areas) that are limited to the number of new questions accepted daily.", rule applies ONLY to the following forums:ArthritisBreast CancerChild Behavioral HealthDental HealthDermatologyDiabetesEye CareHeartHIV Prevention & Safe SexMental HealthNeurologyOvarian Cancer (beginning June 15. 2006)Respiratory DisordersSTDStroke RehabilitationThyroidUrologyAll other forums do not have this restriction, however we ask people to please be considerate and give everyone a chance at getting their new question posted.We hope this clears up any confusion about the "rules".Med Help InternationalTake Care

I am aware of the discussions that took place on this matter. However it is common curtesy for one person to not take up three new posts. It is not her fault as she is new but I was just bringing it to her attn.
WENT TO DOCTOR YESTERDAY HPT NEGATIVE, BUMMED

question: I am 3 days late and now i have started lite bleeding but not like a normal period, no cramps and now i am VERY dizzy all the time, just sitting and very dizzy, it's weird. What is going on?!
title: light spotting and Dizzy
